intro: Diosma recurva, commonly known as the curly diosma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture. Diosma recurva is often grown as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
